text:
The High Court on Tuesday dismissed a PIL petition, which wanted the administrative side of the court not to recommend advocates and judicial officers for elevation to the post of judges of the High Court, till the modified Memorandum of Procedure (MoP) for selection of judges to the higher judiciary was put in place by the Union government, as per the apex court’s direction.

A Division Bench comprising Chief Justice Subhro Kamal Mukherjee and Justice Ravi Malimath passed the order, while observing that “we do not think that this is a matter of public interest…” and bereft of merits.

Petitioner M. Veerabhadraiah, an advocate, had sought for a direction for disclosing names of persons who were being considered for the post of judges as the Supreme Court wanted transparency.

However, the Bench observed that till the MoP was modified by considering suggestions received from various quarters, the stakeholders have decided to proceed with the existing MoP.
title: Will proceed with existing MoP for judges’ post: HC
